.
Para este día quise poner un video (acelerado) de parte de mi esfuerzo para intentar lograr esta postura. Como pueden ver, aún me falta mucho. Aún no puedo poner las rodillas donde deberían estar, no puedo estirar los brazos y apenas logré mantenerme arriba durante un segundo, pero mi cara de felicidad se debe a que desde que comenzaron estos 30 días, le temía muchísimo al día 12 y jamás pensé que pudiera levantar ambos pies ni por 0,02 segundos.😅

node.text: What is it that would be pouring out of you like a free-flowing river if not for the blocks you’ve created in fear of being too vulnerable? To be vulnerable is to be fully alive. Open up your heart to be open to and create space for both the joy and the sorrow; one cannot exist without the other. Moving out of your comfort zone can be daunting, but the growth will allow you to overcome obstacles with more ease and to not resist the unexpected. Follow what you love and trust that you are just as worthy of sharing your passions as the person next to you. Everyone you meet along the way is a teacher; This one happened to remind me that being able to make different shapes with my body is actually pretty rad 💗

node.text:
5 days of #AYearOfYoga2019 with @cyogalife 
Day 10 supposed to be One Leg Crow or #EkaPadaBakasana but ended up in Crow or #Bakasana 
Extending one leg seems impossible at this point. I know that’s not true but it def feels out of my reach. This means more practice, more time in this pose. I will note that placing my knee lower on my arm towards the elbow and flexing my knee to the max created two very flat and perfect surfaces to begin the extension of one leg. 
Day 11 #TittibhasanaB
My flexibility has improved so very much. Almost through the legs. 
Day 12 #EkaPadaSirsasana
I honestly thought there’s no way I’m getting my leg behind my head. Surprise! Surprise! I’m supporting my leg so there’s not a lot of pressure on my neck. The ultimate goal is to rest the leg in the crook of the neck and sit up and look up, locking the pose in. 
Day 13 #TransversalSplits or #Samakonasana
Further and further... deeper and deeper every time I visit this pose. One day I will simply rock forward and be in full Samakonasana. 
Day 14 #Kapotasana
Major emotional blockages during this pose. Waves of panic washed through my entire body as I descended into this deepest of backbends. Honestly not sure how I achieved this level of bend. It was all a blur of excitement and panic. Keeping form was the most difficult aspect. Maintaining space in the spine, opening the chest, keeping the shoulders in line with the scapula, keeping the elbows in, holding the head off the ground and not collapsing down. WHEW! There’s an awful lot happening in this pose. 
#Transformation 💙🦋🙏🏻 #MyYearOfYoga2019

Mat by @karoncelebrateseverything

With over 50 classes on the schedule at the studio each week, you’ll definitely find a style of yoga that resonates with you.
•
We always recommend beginners to start with Bikram Yoga, as it’s such an accessible style of yoga that anyone can try. But not everyone loves the heat, and so we have a variety of classes held at room temperature. These classes - like Yogasana, Jivamukti and Vinyasa Flow - provide an opportunity to explore a greater variety of postures and movement. They’re a great place to start your yoga journey, but also a perfect step onwards once you’ve found your feet in the hot room.
•
Come and try Vinyasa Flow with Chris on Tuesday at 11:15am or Rocket Yoga with Davide at 8pm!
•

I've likely proclaimed it here before, but will happily do so again... #crowpose or #bakasana is one of my fav #armbalances 🤗 ( Ignore the sweaty hair I'm flipping around, this was after a solid hour of some heart pumping power yoga. 🙃)
I remember the first time a couple of years ago that I ever took flight into crow, and although I couldn't hold the pose for long, was so elated that I didn't faceplant. It was my first "advanced" pose and reallllly cemented for me how capable my body is and truly helped me to deepen my practice, which is continually evolving and growing. 
Still feels so invigorating! •

node.text: “Devamli pratik halinde olan yogi, egoyu gorur ve bilir haldedir. Farkindadir. Yine niyamalarla gelen teslimiyet ise, yoginin “kendi olma” cabasini “olma” hali ile degistirir. Bu degisim, o muazzam donusumun en buyuk adimidir. Kisinin kendi olarak tanimladigi hersey, asil olani hukumsuz kilar.” Bir Yoginin El Kitabi/Yoga Sutralar 1 - Cetin Cetintas 🧡🙏🏼📿 #nightpractice #instavideos #yogavideos #yogavibes #homeyoga #nightyoga #beforesleeping #yogapratice #tripodheadstand #bakasana #crowpose

Less than a year ago there’s no way I could have balanced my legs on my arms in this posture. 
Goes to show that practise, failing, falling, trying different techniques, adding the word “yet” to the sentence “I can’t do that..” makes all the difference. 
Reading an amazing book at the moment by Carol Dweck - in it says ‘effort ignites ability.’ Effort - that’s what makes the difference. That and knowing you can continually improve and grow (doesn’t have to be physical; can be work, love, mentally, relationships..)
It’s been a great couple of weeks teaching barre and yoga to see the effort and determination ignited in people in class - hope it continues 🙌🏼

So thankful for all the sunshine filled days we’ve been having in Seattle. 🌞 I don’t know about you, but I was getting pretty close to becoming one with the couch - Classic Kapha imbalance.
•
Kapha Dosha 101
The kapha dosha is comprised of the elements earth and water and is known as the care taker, as it helps us feel calm and content, it builds and nourishes our tissues, and it protects all of the physical systems in the body.
Kapha holds the qualities of:
Heavy: Creates stability and the building blocks that nourish and maintain the body.
Moist: Reduces dryness and lubricates the body.
Cold: Protects the body from excess heat and acidity.
Sticky: Provides insulation that protects the body.
.
.
.

node.text: “What if I fall? Oh but darling, what if you fly? We get scared. We Gail. We get scared of falling, &we fall from time to time! We can NOT allow fear of falling to keep us from spreading our wings” -Erin Hanson. Day 12 #30dayyogajourney is Bakasana. This is one of the first arm balances many people try. It can be intimidating because fear will keep us from leaning forward and lifting off. It is a great metaphor for life as we dream of flying yet never try to lift off. I became more confident in this pose with some tips from @yancyscotschwartz back when I lived in LA. I can say that it is still a challenge somewhat because the mind gets loud and introduces fearful scenarios. I am grateful to have a body and mind that continues to show up in spite of the ego. If you are scared to fall place a pillow in front of you in case you lose your balance. Draw all your energy in and up and activate your pelvic floor like crazy. Breathe into back body, spread your wings/shoulder blades and FLY. It is empowering. #bakasana #armbalance #ashtangalover #yogamiami #miami #elportal #crow #onedaystraightarms #miamiyogateacher

Catching up (from a few days ago but apparently lost my will to post!🤦‍♀️) with #ayearofyoga2019. People doing this challenge year after year can look back and see their progress, and while some of these postures (at least in their most intense variation) are out of my realm as a yogi right now, I’m still learning some things just by practicing. My body has changed from last year at this time - I had only barely begun my running journey and while I know physically I’m much stronger in my legs and core, I’m also less agile. Distance running has some unpleasant partners in crime, notably stiffness and tight spots (hamstrings, hello). At first I was discouraged by how I seem to have gone backwards in my practice and thought about moving on to another challenge - but realized that would defeat the purpose here and there’s always benefit in getting on my mat, playing around, and learning what my body can do. Challenge is good for us (for me at least). Plus, one word I hoped to take into 2019 is DEPTH - (thanks to my running pal @runsamtri for the inspiration!) or the practice of digging deeper, even uncomfortably, into life. All this self-absorbed nonsense over a few yoga poses, sorry! Final take-home: getting on my mat and being able to move is a luxury and a gift. The loss of flexibility in some areas can be gained back, and balancing my yoga with running in the past year is something I definitely don’t regret! Guess I’ll just have to get on that mat more often to ease into the tight spots. @cyogalife 
These photos are in the wrong order, but we have #splits or #hanumanasana, a #seatedtwist (I had to use a variation on this one), #grasshopperpose (working on straightening that leg!), #handstandsplits (mine is #headstandsplitsclearly) and #crowpose or #bakasana. More on its way with less introspection, I promise! 😊 @cyogalife @shine8out

node.text:
Crow Pose or Bakāsana Instructions by 500-hour RYT @suthernyogipdx —yoga student @elephantmediapdx 🧘🏽‍♀️🧘🏽‍♀️ “Begin in Malasana or a low squat. Slide the elbows under the knees and find your rounded, flexed spine. The belly will activate, but make sure you can still breath easily into the lower abdominals. Press into the finger tips and the inner edge of the hand, thumb, and index finger base, and relax the face, jaw, and tongue in the mouth. Relax the eyes and find a drishti point. Press down and lean slightly forward until there is a natural lightness in the feet. Once lifted, create resistance by pretending like you’re going to push your knees down and back. This will lengthen the crown of the head forward. The best way to keep a pose active is to feel how your body might come out of it.” ||—>💛<—||
Resistance movements learned from @simonsynergy during the 300-hour teacher training by @yoga_synergy in Bali. I remain in gratitude for his immense knowledge and teachings. 🙏🏽 #simonborgolivier #yogasynergy #bakasana #resistancemovement #practicepracticepractice #smallclassesyourpractice #yogatoyoupdx #crowpose #alamedayogapdx
...
📸 @chiefmem

30 days yoga journey - Day 12 烏鴉式，Bakasana

這次示範的烏鴉很精彩，有台灣火箭祖師爺 Corey Wu，祖師爺的火箭大弟子 Bruce Lin老師，學姊 Cara Huang，還有我TT的同學紅豆老師 Redbean Hung，一起為大家示範烏鴉進化史。從泰迪熊➡️胚胎烏鴉➡️烏鴉➡️直手烏鴉➡️無腿烏鴉 (依序是Lisa, Cara, 紅豆, Bruce, Corey) ====== Day 12 Crane pose, Bakasana

I am extremely excited to invite my teacher, Corey Wu, who is the first man introduce Rocket Yoga in Taiwan, and his students, include Bruce Lin, my current rocket yoga teacher, and two yoga teachers, Cara Huang and Redbean Hung who perform Crane pose transition with me. From left to right are, teddy bear, baby crow, crane pose and finally a flying crane!

Always work within your own range of limits and abilities. If you have any medical concerns, talk with your doctor before practicing.

Join the journey: https://omstars.com/challenges/30-day-yoga-journey

You are stronger than you think you are. Our bodies are much stronger than our minds let us think most of the time. We just completed week 1 and weekend 1 of @whole30 and I’m feeling mentally stronger and convicted. It’s not an easy program and the hardest part for me has been that it’s very unsociable. It makes going out difficult and limiting but I know I’m doing something great for my body and that it’s all temporary. Overall feeling great after week 1. Less bloated, less brain fog and energy levels are up. Here’s to week ✌🏼! *

I’m a little late to the party, but joining in on omstarsofficial #30dayYogaJourney
and day 12 is #bakasana!
Wanna join me and learn how to safely get into this pose? Click the link in my bio or in my Stories to sign up for this FREE 30 day challenge! Each day there is a new instructor guiding us through practice with a fun peak pose to try.
.
This one is also known as #crowpose or #cranepose if I could straighten my arms all the way and I’ve been working on a #longcrowhold2018, now #longcrowhold2019 with my team of #crowfessionals for three years now but had to take a break because of a wrist injury. Slowly getting back to it though, and the reason we are holding this pose is to build strength to one day press from crow to handstand. Anyone wanna join me again for #OnSundaysWeCrow ?
.

I call this after-practice workout. 
It is important to keep our goals at mind and to keep with the actual-activity for the reasons we are here and now. 
Chasing dreams is not dreaming state it’s the opposite
To fulfill our dreams we need to be active towards those stairway steps 
Step by Step in the material world till the top of the dreams

TASAPAINON ALKEMIA WORKSHOP  su 03.02 klo 14-16:30
Tässä workshopissa pääset tutustumaan, maistelemaan ja kokemaan tasapainottelun ILOA!
Käsitasapainoilut tuovat välitöntä energian virtausta niin kehoon kuin mieleemme.
Ne virkistävät mieltä ja voimistavat kehoa monipuolisesti. Harjoitteleminen on hauskaa ja matka ei lopu kesken, koska aina riittää uusia ulottuvuuksia ja opittavaa.
Workshop on avoin KAIKILLE tasoille kunhan olkapääsi ja ranteesi sietävät painoa.
Krama kramalta (vaihe vaiheelta) etenemme kohti erilaisia asanoita. Voit näin löytää itsellesi ja omalle tasollesi sopivan vaihtoehdon.
Harjoitus perustuu Prana Vinyasa tyyliin joka on Yhdysvaltalaisen jooga-opettaja Shiva Rean elämäntyö. Prana Vinyasa on asteittain etenevä energeettinen liike-meditaatio harjoitus, jota rytmittää vuodenajat, kuun kierto sekä oman henkilökohtaisen energian seuraaminen. Uuden kuun aikaan sopii hyvin uudet intentiot  sekä uuden oppiminen. Parempaa ajankohtaa et voisi saada ITSELLESI.
Workshopin pitää ihana Hanna ja sen hinta on yksi kerta Lumon voimassa olevalta kortilta+15€ tai ilman korttia 45€.
Voit varata paikkasi mukaan osoitteessa www.yogaroomlumo.fi 
Harjoitukseen kuuluu aina huolellinen alkulämmittely sekä Shavasana

node.text:
And SPLAT!
A nice yoga lesson to not be grabby or attached to postures, or well, anything actually! Peacefulness is in not wanting 😄
Me and my good friend @yoga_perspectives have been working on unravelling the mechanical and energetic puzzle of this dynamic Ashtanga transition, and had a breakthrough when we realised you really have to squeeze the hell on to your arms to suck up into crow and, as Joey Miles says in his Purple Valley youtube video 'get your bum rocket high!' Well I finally sucked up without the feet touching the floor but in the effort lost my chaturanga ha ha ha! Bhuja means Arm and Pida means Pressure.  You have to get solid inner thighs going on!
Onwards and upwards!
Don't compare yourself to others OR to your practise yesterday or tomorrow! Just keep going! All work is valid! Yoga is skill in action!  Karma yoga is working without desiring the fruits of your work! It's the mindful duty of practising consistently that is important 😄

People getting ready for bakasana trying level best to achieve in @purplegrape_2011. 
Yoga is not about achieving poses. Enjoy the process till you reach the pose and then once you reach the pose improvising it and perfecting it. 
This is for all those who are newbies for advanced poses , once you achieve the balance there is no fun in falling. So enjoy the wrong doings to get that balance right😅😅. But with awareness that 
1. May be you not using the bhandas right
2. May be you are overdoing it
3. Hopefully you are avoiding injuries
4. Knowing how to do it even if you are physically doing it wrong. 
If you keep all these points in mind ; everytime you are doing an Asana ; it will automatically creepinto your practice. 
Have a safe practice 😃
Come and practice with me 
Class is around Building core strength
Using Bhandas

WORKSHOP: 💪Armbalanser💪 Søndag 20/1 på @corebalance.no i Oslo kl 13-16. Du kommer til å lære masse teknikk, bygge styrke, utvikle fleksibilitet og bli kjent med arkitekturen bak disse stillingene der man bærer all vekt på hendene, noe som gjør dem lettere å få til enn man kanskje skulle tro. Jeg garanterer at alle deltakere kommer til å klare #kråka, som du ser her (sveip for resten av videoene). Men vi skal også utforske mindre kjente varianter fra denne morsomme familien av yogastillinger, som for eksempel #ekapadakoundinyasana #ekapadagalavasana #astavakrasana og #titibasana. Og husk at det blir masse stretching og avbalansering mellom slagene, så ikke vær redd for at det blir FOR mye✌️ Oppfordrer alle som har lyst til å lære mer om yogateknikk til å melde seg på, for her kommer du til å plukke opp mye som er verdifullt langt utover selve armbalansene, og som etterhvert kommer til å løfte praksisen din (og kanskje til og med livet ditt generelt) til nye høyder 🙌👐🖐Kr 600. Link til påmelding og betaling via lenke i bio ⬆️ #workshop #armbalances #mariafurstyoga #corebalance #bakasana #turtorial #yogateacher #runandrelax

node.text:
⠀
Day 7 of the #FunDationsOfYoga
⠀
True Life: I hate Bakasana.
⠀
Yes I know, the poses you hate are the ones you are supposed to work on the most. And I avoid #CranePose like the plague🤢🤕🤮
⠀
Let’s first break this down, there is a difference between #CranePose (#Bakasana) and #CrowPose (#Kakasana) In Crane Pose, the goal is to have straight arms and in Crow Pose, your arms are bent and your body is much closer the ground. Mine (and I feel like the majority) falls somewhere in-between 🤷🏼‍♀️
⠀
If you’re just starting to play around with crow pose, start by placing a block underneath your forehead (or a big pillow for a soft crash landing!)...then by planting palms flat on the floor, lifting hips high, bringing knees up high onto the backs of the arms (or wrap outside the triceps). Then squeeze inner things, engage pelvic floor, shift forward, basically squeeze everything you’ve got, say a little prayer and hope for liftoff 😂😂
⠀
And if you’re like me and you strongly dislike this pose...go get to work🙌🏻
⠀
✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨✨
It's a new year and a new start!
Let's kick off 2019 with a solid foundation of fun yoga poses!
Join us for #FunDationsOfYoga January 7-18
⠀
Each day we will present a foundational yoga pose - your teachers will offer modifications & fun variations.  By the end of the challenge you will have the template for a home practice that can be adjusted for your needs.
⠀
🎊 Here’s how to play along:
✨ Follow all hosts & sponsors
✨ Share this flyer on your page with the hashtag #FundationsOfYoga & tag your friends to join
✨ Check out the hosts’ posts each day of the challenge for helpful ideas, tips & tricks. Then share YOUR practice of the day’s pose!
✨ Tag hosts, sponsors & include the hashtag #FundationsOfYoga each day on your public posts so we can see you & give you some love.
✨ Most importantly—do what feels comfortable for YOU and have fun!
⠀

I’m a little late to the party, but joining in on @omstarsofficial #30dayYogaJourney
and day 12 is #bakasana!
Wanna join me and learn how to safely get into this pose? Click the link in my bio or in my Stories to sign up for this FREE 30 day challenge! Each day there is a new instructor guiding us through practice with a fun peak pose to try.
.
This one is also known as #crowpose or #cranepose if I could straighten my arms all the way and I’ve been working on a #longcrowhold2018, now #longcrowhold2019 with my team of #crowfessionals for three years now but had to take a break because of a wrist injury. Slowly getting back to it though, and the reason we are holding this pose is to build strength to one day press from crow to handstand. Anyone wanna join me again for #OnSundaysWeCrow ?
.

node.text:
Bring on the BLOCKS!
Blocks are by far my favorite yoga prop, especially for accessing day 7️⃣ of #fundationsofyoga - crow pose! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
For more leverage, try stepping (carefully) onto a block & THEN working into crow! Knees will be higher and a bit easier to position into armpits 💃🏻
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
Afraid of falling on your face?! (Its happened to us all 🤣) put something under it! I’m obviously using a block ☝🏽 but a pillow will also work! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
